intro: Xanthobrychis heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leathery liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming liverwort that typically grows on moist, shaded rock surfaces or soil. The plant exhibits a variety of leaf shapes, which contribute to its common name, and it has a distinctive yellowish-green color. It is characterized by its tightly packed, overlapping leaves and a lack of true roots. Xanthobrychis heterophylla is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to survive in nutrient-poor environments.
